author: realbigsean
content:

author: axic3354
content: Nice, thank you! Do you have the unit tests committed to ethereumjs?

author: kevaundray
content: That repo is for testing the cryptography functions, so initially it did not have any direct test vectors for the precompile -- I'm currently refactoring and adding these in on a local branch anyways, with the assumption that they will be moved somewhere higher up in the protocol

author: kevaundray
content: Here is what my local branch currently spits out; <@403636673914863626> I think this should make your tests easier to read as the input is exactly what you would pass into the precompile function

author: kevaundray
content: `FailureMode` is there only for debugging, so I would not add any asserts on those as they are likely to change

author: kevaundray
content:
Just pushed the code to master, so you should be able to generate these yourselves. 

There are tests against go-kzg, so if any of the test vectors fail, you can also cross-reference and work backwards from that codebase
